intro: Johrenia sieversii, commonly known as the Sievers' johrenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Central Asia, particularly found in countries like Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically grouped in clusters, and it thrives in dry, arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
